intro: Anguria villosa, commonly known as the hairy cucumber, is a flowering plant belonging to the Cucurbitaceae family. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. The plant produces yellow flowers that are typically unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant. Its fruit is a cylindrical, green cucumber-like structure that can grow up to 30 centimeters in length. Anguria villosa is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas and is often found in moist, disturbed habitats.
